title.narrative: Fair Trade Cashew Nut Value Chain Development

description.narrative: 1) Community Mobilization/sensitization of 200 participating farmers. 2) Develop profile and database for participating farmers. 3) Organize participating farmers into groups to participate in fair trade audit 4) Assess partner (Lake Kenyatta Cooperative Society) capacity to identify gaps. 5) Capacity building based on identified gaps and needs assessment. 6) Conduct Fair Trade value Chain Analysis for local and export market. 7) Farmers assisted to access appropriate agrochemicals and fertilizers. 8) Training of farmers groups of fair trade standards and best crop husbandry. 9) Set up of cashew processing factory and purchase of cashews from farmers. 10) Selection & preparation of 500 farmers for Fair Trade Audit. 11) Establish business relationships and connect cashew farmers with the Fair Trade market. 12) TSA Audit of farmers groups. 13) Fair Trade certification of groups and payment of social premium to farmers

The project goal is to empower cashew nut farmers to increase production for increased incomes and resilience for better livelihoods. The objectives are: 1) Promote improved farming practices among small scale cashew nut farmers in Lamu County for increased productivity. 2) Introduce new technologies in cashew nut handling and processing to meet internationally acceptable standards. 3) Connect and link farmers to national and international markets through the Fair Trade market.
